CreateCfsFileSystem.document: This API is used to create a file system.
CreateCfsFileSystem.name: Creates a file system

CreateCfsPGroup.document: This API is used to create a permission group.
CreateCfsPGroup.name: Creates a permission group

CreateCfsRule.document: This API is used to create a permission group rule.
CreateCfsRule.name: Creates a permission group rule

DeleteCfsFileSystem.document: This API is used to delete a file system.
DeleteCfsFileSystem.name: Deletes a file system

DeleteCfsPGroup.document: This API is used to delete a permission group.
DeleteCfsPGroup.name: Deletes a permission group

DeleteCfsRule.document: This API is used to delete a permission group rule.
DeleteCfsRule.name: Deletes a permission group rule

DeleteMountTarget.document: This API is used to delete a mount target.
DeleteMountTarget.name: Deletes a mount target

DescribeAvailableZoneInfo.document: This API is used to query the availability of a region.
DescribeAvailableZoneInfo.name: Queries the availability of a region

DescribeCfsFileSystemClients.document: This API is used to query clients on which this file system is mounted. To do so, the client needs to have the CFS monitoring plugin installed.
DescribeCfsFileSystemClients.name: Queries file system clients

DescribeCfsFileSystems.document: This API is used to query file systems.
DescribeCfsFileSystems.name: Queries file systems

DescribeCfsPGroups.document: This API is used to query the list of permission groups.
DescribeCfsPGroups.name: Queries the list of permission groups

DescribeCfsRules.document: This API is used to query the list of permission group rules.
DescribeCfsRules.name: Queries permission group rules

DescribeCfsServiceStatus.document: This API is used to query the status of the CFS service.
DescribeCfsServiceStatus.name: Queries the status of the CFS service

DescribeMountTargets.document: This API is used to query the mount targets of a file system.
DescribeMountTargets.name: Queries the mount targets of a file system

SignUpCfsService.document: This API is used to activate the CFS service.
SignUpCfsService.name: Activates the CFS service

UpdateCfsFileSystemName.document: This API is used to update a file system name.
UpdateCfsFileSystemName.name: Updates a file system name

UpdateCfsFileSystemPGroup.document: This API is used to update the permission group used by a file system.
UpdateCfsFileSystemPGroup.name: Updates the permission group for a file system

UpdateCfsFileSystemSizeLimit.document: This API is used to update the capacity limit of a file system.
UpdateCfsFileSystemSizeLimit.name: Updates the capacity limit of a file system

UpdateCfsPGroup.document: This API is used to update the information of a permission group.
UpdateCfsPGroup.name: Updates the information of a permission group

UpdateCfsRule.document: This API is used to update a permission rule.
UpdateCfsRule.name: Updates a permission group rule

members.document: Sale status. Valid values: sale_out (sold out), saling (purchasable), no_saling (non-purchasable)
members.name: SaleStatus

members.document: Protocol type. Valid values: NFS, CIFS
members.name: Protocol

members.document: Region availability. If a region has at least one AZ where resources are purchasable, this value will be `AVAILABLE`; otherwise, it will be `UNAVAILABLE`
members.name: RegionStatus

members.document: Storage class. Valid values: `SD` (standard storage) and `HP` (high-performance storage)
members.name: Type

members.document: Indicates whether prepaid is supported. `true`: yes; `false`: no
members.name: Prepayment

members.document: Chinese and English names of an AZ
members.name: ZoneName

members.document: AZ name, such as "ap-beijing-1". For the list of regions and AZs, please see [Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/582/13225?from_cn_redirect=1)
members.name: Zone

members.document: Network type. Valid values: VPC (VPC), BASIC (basic network)
members.name: NetInterface

members.document: File system protocol type. Valid values: NFS, CIFS. If this parameter is left empty, NFS will be used by default
members.name: Protocol

members.document: File system storage class. Valid values: SD (standard), HP (high-performance)
members.name: StorageType

members.document: VPC ID. This field is required if network type is VPC.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: Subnet ID. This field is required if network type is VPC.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document: Specifies an IP address, which is supported only for VPC. If this parameter is left empty, a random IP will be assigned in the subnet
members.name: MountIP

members.document: A unique string supplied by the client to ensure that the request is idempotent. Its maximum length is 64 ASCII characters. If this parameter is not specified, the idempotency of the request cannot be guaranteed. This string is valid for 2 hours.
members.name: ClientToken

members.document: Whether a file system is encrypted
members.name: Encrypted

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Permission group name, which can contain 1-64 Chinese characters, letters, numbers, underscores, or dashes
members.name: Name

members.document: Permission group description, which can contain 1-255 characters
members.name: DescInfo

members.document: The number of file systems bound to this permission group
members.name: BindCfsNum

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: You can enter a single IP or IP range, such as 10.1.10.11 or 10.10.1.0/24. The default visiting address is `*`, indicating that all IPs are allowed. Please note that you need to enter the CVM instance's private IP here.
members.name: AuthClientIp

members.document: Rule priority. Value range: 1-100. 1 represents the highest priority, while 100 the lowest
members.name: Priority

members.document: Read/write permission. Valid values: RO (read-only), RW (read & write). Default value: RO
members.name: RWPermission

members.document: User permission. Valid values: all_squash, no_all_squash, root_squash, no_root_squash. Specifically, all_squash: any visiting user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_all_squash: a visiting user will be first matched with a local user, and if the match fails, it will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; root_squash: a visiting root user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_root_squash: a visiting root user will be allowed to maintain root account permissions. Default value: root_squash.
members.name: UserPermission

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: File system ID. Note: please call the `DeleteMountTarget` API to delete the mount target first before deleting a file system; otherwise, the delete operation will fail.
members.name: FileSystemId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Information such as resource availability in each AZ and the supported storage classes and protocols
members.name: RegionZones

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Current status of the CFS service for this user. Valid values: none (not activated), creating (activating), created (activated)
members.name: CfsServiceStatus

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

FileSystemClient.document: Information on the file system client

members.document: IP address of the file system
members.name: CfsVip

members.document: Name of the availability zone, e.g. ap-beijing-1. For more information, see regions and availability zones in the Overview document
members.name: Zone

members.document: Path in which the file system is mounted to the client
members.name: MountDirectory

FileSystemInfo.document: Basic information of a file system

members.document: Maximum storage limit of a file system
members.name: SizeLimit

members.document: Prepaid storage pack bound with the file system
members.name: StorageResourcePkg

members.document: Prepaid bandwidth pack bound to a file system (not supported currently)
members.name: BandwidthResourcePkg

members.document: Information of permission groups bound to a file system
members.name: PGroup

members.document: Whether a file system is encrypted
members.name: Encrypted

members.document: Key used for encryption, which can be the key ID or ARN
members.name: KmsKeyId

members.document: The upper limit on the file system’s throughput, which is determined based on its current usage, and bound resource packs for both storage and throughput
members.name: BandwidthLimit

PGroup.document: Information of permission groups bound to a file system

members.document: The number of bound file system
members.name: BindCfsNum

members.document: Read/write permission. ro: read-only; rw: read & write
members.name: RWPermission

members.document: User permission. all_squash: any visiting user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_all_squash: a visiting user will be first matched with a local user, and if the match fails, it will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; root_squash: a visiting root user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_root_squash: a visiting root user will be allowed to maintain root account permissions.
members.name: UserPermission

members.document: Rule priority. Value range: 1-100. 1 represents the highest priority, while 100 the lowest
members.name: Priority

members.document: Current status of the CFS service for this user. Valid values: none (not activated), creating (activating), created (activated)
members.name: CfsServiceStatus

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: File system capacity limit in GB. Value range: 0-1,073,741,824. If 0 is entered, no limit will be imposed on the file system capacity.
members.name: FsLimit

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Permission group name, which can contain 1-64 Chinese characters, letters, numbers, underscores, or dashes
members.name: Name

members.document: Permission group description, which can contain 1-255 characters
members.name: DescInfo

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: You can enter a single IP or IP range, such as 10.1.10.11 or 10.10.1.0/24. The default visiting address is `*`, indicating that all IPs are allowed. Please note that you need to enter the CVM instance's private IP here.
members.name: AuthClientIp

members.document: Read/write permission. Valid values: RO (read-only), RW (read & write). Default value: RO
members.name: RWPermission

members.document: User permission. Valid values: all_squash, no_all_squash, root_squash, no_root_squash. Specifically, all_squash: any visiting user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_all_squash: a visiting user will be first matched with a local user, and if the match fails, it will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; root_squash: a visiting root user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_root_squash: a visiting root user will be allowed to maintain root account permissions. Default value: root_squash.
members.name: UserPermission

members.document: Rule priority. Value range: 1-100. 1 represents the highest priority, while 100 the lowest
members.name: Priority

members.document: Client IP or IP range allowed for access
members.name: AuthClientIp

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId
